review.itemreviewed: Haldigrat Air HS Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love this jacket! Lightweight, great fit, and sturdy zippers. I wear this over an insulated jacket on super cold backcountry days.

review.itemreviewed: Haldigrat Air HS Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I bought this because I wanted a longer jacket that would cover my behind and have deep pockets. I love the fit of the jacket over my layers, the variety of pockets have been great. There's a chest pocket to fit skins in, I don't use it but it's nice to have for other odds and ends like pocket snacks or a soft water flask. 

I'd honestly get this again. I've only worn it a handful of times out on full day tours. It lives in my pack when it's nice out, and has come in handy to help with wind and other elements.
review.name: Great touring jacket

name: Haldigrat Air HS Hooded Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: Best underwear I have. Perfect for travel. I never have to worry about them riding up or down. They just fit. Period.

review.reviewBody: Fit is good and material is soft! I dont find that they stay in place quite as well as the regular briefs when hiking. Its not a huge problem, but it does happen. review.name: Mostly great!

review.reviewBody:
Wow, just wow! Where do I even begin? I recently upgraded to this seat post clamp, and it has been nothing short of a revelation on the trails. First off, this clamp is a stunner. The vibrant blue pops against my frame, making it not just a component, but a standout piece of art.

But it's not just about looks. Oh no. This clamp has seriously elevated my bke's performance. This clamp keeps my saddle just where I need it and tightens up my cornering, improves on-trail grip, and elevates my bunny hop technique!

The build quality is unmatched. You can feel the robustness in its grip. It's like this little piece of equipment whispers, 'Go ahead, push harder; Ive got you.' And push harder I do. My rides are faster, smoother, and more aggressive than ever before, thanks to the stability and reliability that this clamp provides.

In conclusion, if you're looking to upgrade a critical component of your mountain bike forget a new wheelset, look no further than this seat post clamp. It's more than just a clamp; it's a small investment that pays huge dividends in performance and steez!
review.name: Game-Changer on the Trails

review.reviewBody: Pairs up with my chris king gold components to bring the bike together.  Love this product.
review.name: Good Quality and Great Color

name: Seatpost Clamp

review.reviewBody: I love the fit of these shorts and the material of the short itself feels great- dries quickly. Have yet to test in the field to see how durable they are. However, after the first wear one of the pockets had a hole immediately. Fluke? Wore again. Washed. Now the other pocket has a hole too. Quite disappointing, because having pockets is a huge draw in these shorts.
review.name: Like the fit, pockets have holes

review.reviewBody: Recycled material provides lightweight, quick-drying performance. Abrasion-resistant fabric and reinforced seams increase durability. Elasticized waist with integrated belt gives a customized fit.
review.name: KAVU Elle Short

review.reviewBody: I love the idea of these shorts, but the design didn?t quite do it for me. They were a bit more snug than I like for hiking, and there were no zippered pockets - only loose, Velcro openings - not the most practical. The banana split was a great color though!
review.name: Wish they would?ve worked for me!

review.reviewBody:
I bought this jacket in hopes of having some great new outerwear for skiing, but ended up returning this jacket. It seemed like it would be warm and comfortable, but I never wore it outside so I can't confirm. There was plenty of room and felt like layering would not be a problem. Ultimately the fit of this jacket just didn't suit me. The sleeves were way too long on me. A slightly longer sleeve is something I'm used to since I'm short (5'5") but stocky in build (Size 12, 180 lbs) and generally require an XL jacket, but the sleeves on this jacket felt exceptionally long. I bought it it two colors and found the same with both jackets. It also fanned out at the bottom, giving it a bell bottom type of look. I used the cords at the bottom of the jacket to draw it in a bit so that it looked a bit more normal. I wanted to love it, but ultimately ended up returning it due to the fit in hopes I'd find a jacket that fit my arm length better. (I did end up with another HH jacket that fit me better)

Giving it 4 stars because it seemed great - just not for someone with my proportions :-). Hope this helps someone else!
review.name: Nice jacket, wrong fit for me.

review.reviewBody: The materials and colors are very nice and it is a high-quality jacket. Unfortunately, it does not fit because it has a "relaxed" cut and the person I got it for is too thin. I had to return it.
review.name: Nice, but "relaxed" cut

review.reviewBody: I wanted to like this coat, but it just wasn't what I personally was looking for. The insulation was great, sizing was True to Size, however at the bottom of the coat, it had only what I could describe as a bell-bottom fit. It flared out at the bottom, and that just isn't my cup of tea. I did end up returning the coat, the colors are beautiful!
review.name: SO Close to perfect

name: Powchaser 2.0 Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect for summer backpacking, travel or a contingency blanket for the car. Super-lofty, High quality down and top-notch workmanship. Stuffs down to half the size of my 20-degree down bag!
review.name: Perfect down quilt

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great backpacking bag. Warm, light and packs small.
review.name: Great Sleeping Bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sleeping bag is so comfortable! It feels like youre sleeping on clouds.  It is very durable, and packs down very small.  I went to a hotel and slept with this on top of the bed bc I hate hotel blankets, and  Ive also used this camping.  Its so versatile!
review.name: A favorite

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I live in the desert, so this was perfect to test drive  in 72F Las Vegas weather.  I wasnt too hot or too cold, this sleeping bag is lightweight and durable.  My only complaint, would be I am 510 tall, I didnt have a lot of wiggle room.  This thing is perfect for on-the-go and a good nights sleep wherever you are!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received this sleeping bag from seatosummit & Influenster in exchange for my honest review. 1st of all I think this is the prettiest sleeping bag Ive even seen!! Its also the softest, most comfortable!! The material almost feels like silk. Its a down sleeping bag!! I didnt even know there was such a thing!! Its so so soft!! Its also waterproof. Its made from recycled polyester fabrics. Its a hybrid that can convert into a blanket. Its very lightweight with 2 different bags to store it in. It has a life time warranty. I am very pleased with this sleeping bag!! I feel like its the best there is!!
review.name: The best!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So I got this traveller size down sleeping bag for free to review and I used it one time in my backyard and its so warm and comfortable I would definitely recommend this to anyone

Super happy with this one!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is such an amazing sleeping bag. So lightweight and easy to pack. Very warm and comfortable. Seems to be very durable. By far my favorite sleeping bag.

First it comes with an amazing carrier bag ! Easy to take on the go for hiking camping etc ! High quality sleeping bag, Id highly recommend

hasVariant.name: Brushed Terry Hoodie - Past Season - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Brushed Terry Hoodie - Past Season - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Take it from me and the other reviewers this hoodie shrinks.  I typically wear a size XS or S top, and I bought a medium.  It arrived and was too big (as expected pre-wash).  Followed care instructions, crossed my fingers and hoped it would shrink to the correct size in the dryer.  Now it is relatively snug.  Fits more like an XS.  However, the hood shrunk enough that it is completely useless; when pulled up, it covers the back half of my head and pulls up on the shoulders.  To reduce further shrinkage, it will hang dry in the future.  It is maybe worth the $13 sale price, but not much more than that.  

TLDR: Buy at least one or two sizes up, dont buy it for anything more than $15, and dont expect to have a functional hood regardless of sizing up.
review.name: An okay sweatshirt if you size way up

review.itemreviewed: Brushed Terry Hoodie - Past Season - Women's
review.reviewBody: It definitely shrinks. Badly. So cozy and soft on the first wearing, and loved the gray color. I dry all my clothes on delicate and this shrunk terribly - to the point of being unwearable. The sleeves are ridiculously short and its like a snug crop sweatshirt now. Either buy like 3 sizes up or skip this one if you like to wash your clothes. Im bummed because it was a great sweatshirt and I bought it in the blue too, but now I cant wear it because I dont want to wash it and have the same thing happen.
review.name: Should have listened to other reviewer!

review.itemreviewed: Brushed Terry Hoodie - Past Season - Women's
review.reviewBody: I loved this sweatshirt on my first wear prior to a wash/dry.  Washed and dried as instructed on care label and the sleeve length has shrunk up above the wrists.  Unfortunate buy as I love the color.
review.name: Shrinks

name: Brushed Terry Hoodie - Past Season - Women's

review.name: Warranty exchange

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] 30% off after I buy it. 
And everything we have purchased has failed or ripped in two outings 
No more seatotrash for our family.
review.name: Failed gear and constantly getting frustrated

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really like the compressibility and weight of this bag. Just what I need for the fall and spring in my area. My only complaint is that the zipper is on the left, which I can't get used to. The door of my Alto TR1 is on the right (as well as most other single door tents) and so is the storage pocket. I am used to being able to unzip the bag a bit and access the door of my tent and the pocket for my phone ect. I can still get to these things but I would prefer the zipper on the right like all my other sleeping bags.
review.name: Almost perfect

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sleeping bag is well made and very functional. Zippers work well and are easy to use. And of course, it's very light, which is the primary reason I got it. 

I'd definitely buy again.
review.name: Excellent product

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This bag is definitely incredible. 
Its packability is superb and its lightweight. 
Its very comfortable in temps well below its 45f rating (32F) with the addition of just a pair of good down booties and a down jacket. 
Ive used it for fastpacking in the high peaks of Colorado with a bivy.
review.name: Heavenly

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this bag! great for ultra light mountain travel.
review.name: Love this bag! great for

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This weighs nothing at all. It's so amazing. I feel lucky to have this. It's crazy warm and soft and cozy. If I could sleep in it every night I would. I'm amazed by how warm this is with it weighing nothing at all.
review.name: Absolutely incredible

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It's a super comfortable, durable, and warm sleeping bag. I was impressed since it is super lightweight and easy to carry, especially with the bag it comes in. I do wish it was more compact, depise it being super lightweight, I feel like it takes up a lot of space.
review.name: Super Light Yet Warm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am so impressed how light this sleeping bag is, but still keeps me warm! Compresses down without a problem - perfect companion for a backpacker/hiker.  Love the attention to detail with the zipper - did not have any issues with snagging.  Camped on a lake island with temps getting in the low 40s and still was comfortably warm.  Material is easy to clean and shake out.  10/10 recommend.
review.name: Light & small, but performs great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sleeping bag is spacious and I love that it has a long zipper that make it easy to get in and out. Its light weight and keep me warm in the cold weather.
review.name: Good sleeping bag

review.itemreviewed: eBIke Lite Pro Drive 800 Switch Headlight
review.reviewBody:
Pros:
*Hardwired and made to work well with a myriad of different ebikes with varying voltages.
*Considered waterproof, not merely water-resistant.
*The wired switch conveniently mounts on the handlebars for quick light mode changes, no fumbling.
*So easy to wire, just need virtually any nearby wire with power to it...
*Throws  an ample yet focused beam of light, won't blind oncoming traffic.
*Heavy duty aluminum housing with heat sink fins also very cool looking.
*Mounting options for headset or fork are sturdy and should work for many applications.
*Compact, lightweight, minimalist yet modern.

With so many plusses (for me anyway) this purchase from Backcountry was a no brainer, really.
review.name: Modern & Marvelous Design from Lezyne

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are the magical shoes that I recommend to everybody. They are lightweight, cushioned, and just *work*. I completely the MRNP Wonderland Trail in these, as well as numerous 15+ mile dayhikes/trail runs. They took a couple of wears to break in, but after that, became my preferred shoe for most activities.
review.name: Go-to hiking and trail running shoes

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is my 4 th or 5 th pair. I can take these boots out of the box and hit the trail with no breaking in. I have arthritis in my big toe and these boots fit well and are flexible but firm enough that I can hike with no pain. They last almost a year for me (600+ miles) of rocky terrain and scrambling. They've been down numerous scree descents and hold up exceptionally well. I can wear them with snowshoes, and also in the heat of summer. I buy 1 size bigger than my usual size so toes stay comfortable on steep descents.
review.name: Best hiking boots!

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these after an ankle injury, they are great. Very comfortable and lots of support. Nice room for my toes as well, Ive worn them on multiple hikes now and they perform very well.I ordered one size up based on recommendations, it worked out well. Im happy I bought them.
review.name: Great Hiking Shoe

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are the third pair of ultra raptor I bought, there first one wrapping my ankle. The boot is light yet sturdy enough to withstand backpacking on talus and hard terrain. The upper part id foldable if you have to put it in your pack when climbing. Great boots. Hope that La sportive will not discontinue them. Watch out they run small order one side up particularly if you hike at elevation and foot swells.
review.name: Light ans great for backpacking

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Purchased in July.  Walked around the house with them and drove with them.  Still breaking them in.  But taking these boots to Inverness, Scotland to Aigas Nature Center.
review.name: fit great

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I thought it was comfortable at first but did not even pass the 10-mile test- not carrying much weight either. Length is correct, but tiny bit narrow at the outside toe. Heel box is ok and can be tightened down to keep heel from moving around.  I got blisters on a day hike and luckily had a better pair of boots with me on the trip.
review.name: wanted to love it; pinkie blisters

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I work at a crystal mine. I climb up and down a mountain all day, in all weather and with gear and crystals. My feet LOVE these shoes! Them are so lightweight and have great support and grip. The fact they are waterproof means that I can wash them off with a hose. I am definitely a happy customer!
review.name: Crystal Mine Worthy

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I bought these as a lighter weight alternative to my typical leather hiking boots for an upcoming scout trip to Philmont.  These are so much lighter that I was concerned I couldn't hoof 10 miles with 35 lbs in them but I was wrong!  Great boots that don't overheat my feet.  All shoes seem to cause me blisters and these are no exception but I can proactively manage them as they are predictable.  I love the wider toe box and the narrower heal cup.  These are working so well for me during training hikes that I bought a second pair in case they wear out before the trip but so far so good!  Only concern I have is keeping an eye on the lacing loops and the laces themselves.  Both are pretty thin and I like to crank on my laces for a better fit.  No issues so far but I'll pack an extra pair of laces on the trip.  One curious note though is that it did take me three pairs to find one that feltl 'new'.  One shoe in one pair had little padding under the insole and the other pair rubbed funny on my pinky toe.  Third time was the charm but I do recommend trying before buying or go through a good company like this where you can easily make an exchange if needed.  The teal and maroon colors are both better in person.  I typically wear size 9 1/2 or a size 10 when wearing thick socks & hiking with a heavier pack. I ordered a size 10 in these and they fit as I hoped.  Would give 4.5 stars if I could. 
 Recommend!
review.name: Light and supportive

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I have a lot of love for these hiking boots - i bought them when starting to work in adventure therapy and outdoor ed. Two years later, they are pretty toasted - the fabric covering on the side is all ripped up and exposing the inside of the boot, the traction on the boot is worn flat, and the sole is coming off.

This boot is super light and breathable, and perhaps for that you pay in a lack of longevity. I'm so grateful that I didn't have to lug a heavy boots through my expeditions!! I used this boot through backpacking trips, disaster relief work, and day program work and they served me well.

The cons are that they were never really waterproof. I had to step in a stream during a wilderness first responder scenario a week after I bought them and immediately got my socks wet. The traction wears fast and i felt unsteady on my backpacking trips where I had to go up rock slopes. The synthetic upper is prone to ripping and tearing.

These shoes are amazing for day hiking and I think anyone who doesn't have rougher aspirations for them than some overnight backpacking will be really happy with them. Just don't count on them to last for years and years as you put miles on them.
review.name: lots of love, but some things to conside

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These boots fit quite well out of the box, which is saying a lot as my feet are hard to fit.  I sized up which worked well (I normally wear an 8.5/39 in street shoes, but bought the 9.5/41 in these boots).  The boots are very lightweight, which I really like for warm weather hiking.  The waterproofing worked well for my first few hikes - my feet stayed dry through many puddles.  After about 30-40 miles, though, my feet got very wet on a hike through tall wet grass.  Disappointing!
review.name: Comfortable, but poor waterproofing

name: Ultra Raptor II Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: My son loves the coat! Fits well, warm but not bulky, and it looks great.

review.reviewBody: Its tough to find clothes that fit for a fairly tall preteen and this was great. Kept him warm, sleeves are long enough that he wont immediately outgrow it. And he loves the look.
review.name: Perfect size for preteen

review.reviewBody:
I was choosing between this jacket and the similarly priced Kids Down Sweater from Patagonia, which I usually buy for my kids. My youngest liked the colors offered by Cotopaxi so we went with this one this year. It doesn't seem as warm as the one we usually get from Patagonia so we'll probably opt for the Patagonia jacket next time.

That all being said, the jacket itself is of high quality and if we were further south, I would definitely buy this jacket again. For reference, we're in the DMV area.
review.name: Beautiful but not as warm as I thought it'd be

review.reviewBody: Kids love it. The colorful mix, the fluffy feel and lightness. Looking forward to a version where it can fold into a pouch and even more colors.

review.reviewBody: Great fit, appears to be quality material, and my daughter loves the color.

review.reviewBody: The colors in the fuego hooded down jacket are vibrant and beautiful. The construction of the garment is excellent. I would like to see a windproof layer and a zippered pocket in the sleeve (for your ski pass) to make it more useful for alpine skiing as a stand-alone jacket. Also, I would love to see a waterproof/windproof shell to add to this cute little down jacket for windy or wet conditions. I would highly recommend this jacket for your outdoor adventures.
review.name: Fuego hooded down jacket - kids

review.reviewBody: My daughter LOVES her new jacket - the fit and colors are just what she was looking for!
review.name: PERFECT kids jacket!

review.reviewBody: We love the jacket. It fits my son well and is warm.
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: Our daughter is very excited about this coat. It fits loosely enough for a sweater this winter, or as a mid layer for skiing! Very nice.
review.name: Our daughter is very excited about this coat.

review.reviewBody: Jacket is beautiful. Bought it for my daughter. It's summer so she hasn't used it a lot but she loves a thin but still warm jacket and we are hoping that this will qualify! We will see come winter!

review.reviewBody: The instructional video shows it's able to hold poles at the back but the women's version is different, it doesn't have the same pole loops.  Fit small even though I followed the size guide, inner material is scratchy.
review.name: Prefer Other Salomon Vests
comment: Hi, thank you for leaving this comment. Were happy to know that our team is handling your case right now, please check your inbox!

review.reviewBody: I bought this vest for training for a half marathon. In my training runs I found it great going shorter distance I had no issues atol but on the race day i was getting chaffing under my arms from the vest and was left with bruises on my ribs from the water bottles. I like the lightness of the vest and over all fit but I think the water bottles really need to be addressed as I have seen in previous reviews this is not just me who has had this issue.
review.name: Overall good vest

review.reviewBody: Bought this to replace my UD vest that was my go to for years. It fits great, but whatever material they decided to use for the PRO is terrible. Its like sandpaper. It has made my neck actually bleed on longer runs. The next issue if youre running an ultra and are swapping bottles out good luck unless you have the exact hard some ones that come with this bag. Both water bottle compartments are torn and Ive had stuff fly out several times.  Terrible product that they will not stand behind.
review.name: Rubs the skin off your neck and tears

review.reviewBody: I was in between sizes on this one so it just didnt work out
review.name: Not for me

review.reviewBody: i took this on my long run, i was expecting it to be better than my skin 8. i have a skin 8 and it is good, didnt rub on my neck. i was expecting this sense pro would be better as you know, its called 'PRO'? but it is not as good as skin 8. i am dissappointed. apart from that, the measurement is off, i dont look like the model in the product images, it was huge on me! my chest measurement is 34, i thought S would be perfect but it is not. it's as if i am wearing my husband's vest
review.name: measurements are off, chafing on my neck
comment: Hello! Thank you very much for your comment. A member of our team will contact you shortly to talk about your experience.

review.reviewBody: It fits like a glove and is so light, plus it has plenty of storage for many hours running on our mountain trails.
review.name: great fit and comfort

review.reviewBody: I love the fit and features on this vest but the mesh interior really chafes my shirts even though its a snug fit so I wont be able to keep using it. Such a bummer because I love everything else about it!
review.name: Great fit but lots of chafe
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We're truly sorry to hear about the issues you encountered with your running vest. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody: I am really happy with the Sense Pro 5, recently I had the Half Marathon of my city and it was so helpful. The two 500ml flasks were perfect for my whole race and kept me hydrated and the pockets were perfect to have my phone, gels, and car keys.
review.name: A must for long distances!

review.reviewBody: Awesome product! Light and practical. Serves and deliver the promised value.
review.name: Light and practical

review.reviewBody: Very disappointed. I wanted to love this vest but let me down after two runs. Now the Flask Tube bounces around while running. Very annoying
review.name: Ripped after two runs- poor design
comment: Hi, we are sorry to hear this happened to you. All our products come with a 2-year warranty against material and manufacturing defects. Please contact our customer service so we can check if this is the case, and we will help you set up a claim. Just follow this link: https://www.salomon.com/contact Thank you.

name: Sense Pro 5L Hydration Vest

review.reviewBody: Solved the very annoying squeaky problem by soaking my sandals in tub overnight and allowing them to air dry. No more squeaking.
review.name: Upgraded my review from 3  to 5

review.reviewBody: Sent mine back...run too narrow for me...going to order different style..
review.name: No run to narrow

review.reviewBody: If your planning on walking for months---this is your sandal. If you have a habit of destroying shoes with your calcified feet in foreign environs, search no longer. My first pair of Teva's traversed with me for over a thousand miles in the first 6 months--and lasted for more walking years after. It is comfy, durable and is as unstoppable as your feet allow you to be. Tallgrass Prairies, watery bogs, and steep rocky climbs yield to your pilgrims feet.
review.name: THE sandal for Pilgrims and Wanderers

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of these. No kidding would wear them 365 days of the year. Except when there is more than 3in of snow on the ground. Also keep my feet from smelling, cuz they don't sweat in these.
review.name: Love the.

review.reviewBody: Took these sandals on a trip recently and fell in love with them. They initially felt a little cramped on my right foot but after a day or so of breaking them in they felt like the perfect fit. I really love the plastic buckle enclosure. Being able to slide my foot in and clip the buckle and have the same fit everytime is my favorite feature. I really wish they put buckles on more of their sandals. The leather does look darker on my pair vs the pair they shown on the website. I personally didn't mind but I know others might.
review.name: Love this product

review.reviewBody: I had hoped for a bit more overall foot support from these Tevas.
review.name: Disappointing

review.reviewBody: I love the Omnium. This is my 3rd pair! They are a good looking shoe for sports and casual wear. Comfortable for light hiking, canoeing, kayaking, etc.
review.name: I love the Omnium. This is my 3rd pair!

review.reviewBody: For me this style did not work. Would have liked to have had padding on heal strap. Had to return.
review.name: Heal strap not padded and rubs blisters on heals

review.reviewBody: The thing I appreciate the most was the ease of returning the pair I bought that were the wrong size
review.name: I would order from this company again

review.reviewBody: This sandal is good for fit but to me the buckle should be at the inside of your foot and not the outside of your foot. After I have made all the Velcro comfort adjustments I want to use the buckle fastener to remove/put-on the sandal. I can easily Reach the inside of my foot and See the inside of my foot. Just me, but this seems like a design flaw. Maybe there is a way to make it reversible???
review.name: I love the Teva brand.

name: Omnium 2 Leather Water Shoe - Men's

description: Buy the KUHL Deceptr Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Deceptr Pant - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the KUHL Deceptr Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I really like the fit of these pants; however, I find that Kuhl's sizing can be a little inconsistent. The pants are very comfortable, and lightweight. They were intended to be my summer (outdoor) work pants, but I'm using them for much more than that. The material can be a little noisy, but it's not too bad. These and the Silencer Rogue's are my favorites from Kuhl.
review.name: Great fit, a little noisy

review.reviewBody: These are great looking/fitting pants.  I ordered and received 33/32 Deceptr in Renegade Kahki. Fit was absolutely perfect.  Just received identical pant/size in Black N Blue.  It is simply too small.  Tried the Khaki on again to make sure I had not gained some pounds.  Khaki still fits perfectly.  Disappointed - I wanted another pair in a different color.
review.name: Kuhl Size quality control

review.reviewBody: I ordered these pants for my husband.  He was looking for a different KUHL pant, but they were difficult to find.  I surprised him with these...he doesn't like changes.  He LOVES them.   I washed them and he wore on the plane and for all of his outdoor activities.  They really stand up to various situations.   BTW. customer service has been exceptional. 5 star plus
review.name: OUDOORS NIDAHO

review.reviewBody: These pants can do anything! Whether it's rock climbing, hiking, or just hanging out with friends. They also look nice enough to wear to work. They are a slim fit. They're are super durable! These are the first pair of pants i've owned that don't wear out in between the thighs; which is the reason I throw out most of my pants. The material is comfortable, and breathes very well. You can't go wrong with these pants, I will be buying more in the future!
review.name: Best pair of pants I've ever owned!

review.reviewBody:
These are the best all around pants I have found. I primarily wear them for outdoor bouldering and hiking, but these pants are my go to for everything. I frequently wear them to workout, do yoga, and have even ran in them a few times without any issues. The material offers an immense level of stretch, comfort, and breathability. The tapered cut gives these pants a stylish look without inhibiting mobility or being too tight on the thighs. 

I have similar pants from adidas outdoor, Patagonia, and Eddie Bauer, but these are far and above my favorite. I bought one pair to try out and that quickly turned into 5. 

Get yourself a pair! You wont be disappointed!
review.name: Best all-around pants I have found!

name: Deceptr Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: I should have bought this a long time ago when I first got my rollers for my bicycle.  This mat is durable and will protect my carpet.

review.reviewBody: I have an indoor exercise bike and my entire apartment is floored in hardwood. Looked high and low for a way to protect my floors while I break a sweat on the bike and finally found it in this mat. The hardest bit about putting it out was having to roll the indoor bike around. I thought it would be a tad thicker, based on what I thought I read in the description, but it does the job I wanted which is protecting the floor. Very easy to clean.

review.reviewBody: Fits my bike, and my indoor trainer perfectly.
review.name: Works perfectly

review.reviewBody: Keep the trainer marks on the mat and the sweat off the floor - NOW GO RIDE!

review.reviewBody: This is so much nicer than the old yoga mat I was using under my Hammer before. The mat is wide and has a good thickness. It catches sweat, protects my floor and absorbs vibration when using my trainer.
review.name: Works much better than an old yoga mat

review.reviewBody: Nice, thin, durable.
review.name: Nice product

review.reviewBody: The mat to end all mats. Light weight easy to unroll and set up. I can't imagine using my trainer without it. The solid black show my dogs hair alot and doesn't inspire me to pedal harder when cranking up the steep inclines using my M2. Sorry, I couldn't help it ;)

hasVariant.name: Competizione Glove - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Castelli Competizione Glove - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Got one pair, got torn apart in no time.  CC sent me a replacement.. same as the first pair.. did not last long.
review.name: Bad Quality

review.reviewBody: I bought 2 pair. They do run small--usually wear a medium, order a medium and they are tight but wearable--so I'd recommend one size up. I like that they have little padding, good gripping surface and look good. No complaints--you forget you have them on.
review.name: Nice minimalist gloves

review.reviewBody: Way too small.  I ordered LARGE, wear a medium, and the gloves are still too small and tight.
review.name: Too Small

review.reviewBody: The first time I used this glove, one of the seams tore.  The stitching separated between the wrist and the thumb as I pulled it on.   I would not buy this product again.
review.name: Tore the First Day

review.reviewBody: What you can't tell by pictures is the additional grip provided by the line looking things on the palms which provide much more tacky grip than a standard glove palm. Not sure about longevity, as I just got them. For me, I think they fit similar to specialized and pearl izumi and larger than giro.
review.name: Airy, minimal padding, great grip.

review.reviewBody: I have big hands and so usually I have to get XXL sizes. I thought, lucky me this one comes in XXL. I couldn't get them on my hands at all. The "high stretch cuff" doesn't stretch enough and there are no fasteners so when the stretch is done, it's either ruin the glove or return them. I chose the latter. Shame. They seemed pretty nice, but definitely didn't fit.
review.name: Not for thick hands

review.reviewBody: The 2XL should more accurately be considered a medium. This isn't just a *little* small; my hand wouldn't remotely fit into this glove. The size chart suggests XXL would fit >26cm hand circumference, but only actually measure 21cm around. 5cm of negative ease would be an enormous amount of stretch, except that the back panel pattern has stitching that prevents most of that potential stretch.
review.name: WARNING: EXTREMELY TINY.

review.reviewBody: These gloves have held up well for me through the summer. A little bit of a pain to get on and off, but that?s not a big deal to me since they are so breathable. They have the right amount of padding on the palm and seem to last. I?ve ridden 1300mi with these gloves and they are showing only a little abrasion on the palm. Great for the hottest days. My bar tape is Supacaz which doesn?t seem to be too destructive towards gloves. Maybe that explains their durability that others have not experienced.
review.name: Nice breathable glove

review.reviewBody: Feel cheap & flimsy; not much padding
review.name: Not Castelli quality

name: Competizione Glove - Men's

description: Buy the Outdoor Research Essential Lightweight Ubertube Kit online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Essential Lightweight Ubertube Kit
hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Essential Lightweight Ubertube Kit online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: We are all so over masks for COVID but when I'm out in the dust on my tractor this mask FITS my face without flattening my nose and it can lightly hang on the ears but not cut into them in addition to the drawstring creating the tension you want around the top.  It keeps the sun off of your neck too!  Breathing through the fabric is easy.  The mask stays in place around the nose with a wire (that our great surgical masks have) so overall it's like wearing something MADE to fit a face that keeps the Great Outdoors out of my lungs.  Well done, Outdoor Research!  I now have 4 of them so I can keep washing them.
review.name: great for dusty projects and sun

review.reviewBody: Great product and material. Very useful when you have to cover yourself while driving in a car and the sun is hitting from the side or directly in front of you. A hat and glasses protect the top part of your head, but the bottom part is left vulnerable to UV rays without this one.
review.name: Great product with much greater use than usual

review.reviewBody: The Ubertube is a great all day mask that stays in place thanks to the handy ear loops. In spring sessions a balaclava is too hot, but I still like to have a mask. This thing is THE TICKET!
review.name: Great all-day mask

review.reviewBody: I use this as my mask when skiing. It stays up, doesn't pull on my ears, and stays away from my face. I don't think it offers as much protection as a paper non-medical mask.
review.name: I love this mask for skiing.

review.reviewBody: Used at the ski resort for mask coverage and a neck tube all built into one. Comfy and great product.
review.name: Useful for mask requirements but also a great neck warmer.

review.reviewBody: I bought this as an alternative to a mask for lifts and inside the lodge. I agree with the other reviewer that the filter doesn't work that well. I do really like it as an alternative to a neck gaiter for colder days, the nose wire and shape makes for a much better fit.
review.name: Better than a normal neck gaiter

review.reviewBody: I love having a lighter weight option for covid protection while skiing, especially one that does not need go around or over my ears. I know this comes with ear loops, but I ignore them and never use them. If the synch in the back is tight enough, the mask stays in place. I only wish the filter area was bigger (this uses OR's smaller filter size) and that there was some way of helping the filter stay in place. If you're constantly pulling it up and down throughout the say, sometimes the filter can bunch up.
review.name: Very versatile protection

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable - stays in place and perfect for having an mask ready for quick stops on the mountain
review.name: Looks good - feels good

review.reviewBody: Used the Ubertube in Aspen for 5 days straight. Easy to wear and comfortable. Stays up where it's supposed (masks don't work if they don't cover your nose people,,,) to. Worth the money.
review.name: this thing works!

review.reviewBody: Wonderfully light weight and flexible with a touch of extra warmth. Very comfortable ear loops even for my big head and ears (unlike on the Essentials Bandana where the loops are too tight). The problem with the filters bunching and sliding out of position is resolved by the use of shaped "3D" PM 2.5 filters instead, you know: the ones that look like the OR medium filters but have an activated charcoal layer. The stiffness of the PM 2.5 3D filters works to hold the filters more firmly in position.
review.name: Love it! But use with "3D" PM 2.5 filters instead

name: Essential Lightweight Ubertube Kit

review.reviewBody: The answer is, its expensive, no getting around that. I put this on my drop bar mountain bike & wish I had done it sooner. Even after reading it in reviews, the action, smoothness & easy of using the AXS dropper is better than expected. No more having to get into the drops to use my former lever. Paired with my shifters, I can drop the seat from any hand position I can shift from, which results in me using it much more often.
review.name: Why did I wait so long?

review.reviewBody:
I bought this to lose the wire I was shocked at a few things.

It is super fast once you touch the paddle to drop or raise the post. Way faster than my previous dropper. 

The ability to put that saddle into exact positions is incredible.

I also enjoy the ease of adjusting saddle tilt. 

This thing is more practical that I realized.
review.name: Luxury, but some serious benefits

review.reviewBody:
If it was not so pricey, I would have gave it 5 stars. Otherwise, it functions perfectly so far and was quick to adjust from cable actuated levers. 

Time will tell how durable it is until it needs serviced.
review.name: Better than Fox Wireless Dropper Post :)

review.reviewBody:
I decided to upgrade the dropper post on my XC bike to the Reverb AXS.  Admittedly, I thought this upgrade was more about embracing technology and getting rid of the dropper cable.  That said, I've found that I use the dropper more frequently because it takes less effort to engage (both at the remote and at the saddle).  It's so easy that I'll even drop the saddle for short stretches. 

Due to the battery placement, you may have to think through seat bag placement.  I got the Lezyne SendIt Caddy and that works fine to hold the spare tube, CO2, and levers without putting any unnecessary pressure on the battery.

I'd definitely recommend the Reverb AXS.
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody:
I recently got a Specialized Epic with AXS drivetrain and needed to add a dropper.  I love the cable free cockpit so wanted a wireless dropper to match. 

Install and set-up were dead simple since no cable routing was involved.  The seat clamp design is better than most and seat position and angle were easy to set.  The remote and dropper paired instantly with no fuss.  There is a tool included for self-service if you ever need to bleed the internal piston.  Battery, charger, and cord were included. 

The remote and dropper combined added exactly one pound compared to the carbon fiber post that it replaced. 

Function seems really good.  Force required to drop it is on par with anything I've used and the return function is perfect. 

Cons:  The remote sits low enough that in a crash it will hit the top tube.  The shifter remote is the same on the AXS drivetrain so now the potential for issues is doubled.  $800 is a crazy amount for a dropper. 

Bonus:  If derailleur battery dies you can swap with the dropper battery.  Maybe I just paid $800 for a spare battery carrier
review.name: "Probably" Five Stars

review.reviewBody: This bag is great when I travel in the car to hold my laptop, books, and all the little things I need. I also love that strap for my yoga mat.
review.name: Love

review.reviewBody: This bag is so versatile! Perfect for road trips, weekend stays, or for the gym. I love the size and the extra pocket on the bottom. My new favorite and go-to bag for daily use!
review.name: I love the weekender bag!

review.reviewBody: I expected to love this bag but didn't know how MUCH I would love this bag. It's the perfect size. It holds more than you think it will and it was really comfortable to carry. I tend to pack light and think I could probably do a 5-day trip with this bag (a full week might be pushing it!)
review.name: Greatest Weekend Bag!

review.reviewBody: This is a wonderful bag. It seems well made and has a lot more room than it seems. I love all of the pockets and the ability to put the bag on top of my rolling suitcase. There are potential options to add a shoulder strap as well. My only addition to this bag would be to make it water resistant all around and the bottom/bottom pocket water proof.
review.name: Great Bag

review.reviewBody: Love this freakin bag. . . and need another one. . . yippie
review.name: Love this freakin bag. . . and need

review.reviewBody: I bought a Weekender Bag for myself last spring and not only loved it but received many complements on it, so I bought another one for my husband for Christmas. One of my favorite details is the zipper pocket underneath the bag for a pair of sandals or slippers.
review.name: We have two now!

review.reviewBody: Although it's called "weekender" I use it for everyday! I'm always on the run and use this bag to throw my things in and head out the door. If they made a smaller one, I would purchase that too. I have also used it as a carry on and for camping. I own other Cotopaxi bags and I use this one the most. I always love the quality and definitely recommend.
review.name: Great bag

review.reviewBody: Just got the weekender bag and already it has fit the ticket for a quick four day ski trip. I like a bag for small purse, computer, books, magazines, gloves and hat. This works great. I will not hesitate to stick it under an airline seat and push on it with my foot as it is very sturdy and a color that wont show any scuffs. It will replace two bags that have seen their day with hard travel. This bag fits does the job and will travel many a mile.
review.name: Weekender Bad

review.reviewBody: Looking forward to using the Weekender bag for our upcoming trip. Its sturdy and fits over the handle of my rolling carry-on. Its not too big for me and the color is unisex so my husband can use it as well.
review.name: Good size Weekender

review.reviewBody: I got this bag and a Batac 24L. This one is great for being on the move and fits a ton of items. Its very spacious. I love all the storage compartments and the ability to clip in a yoga mat if I need. I plan to use it as my climbing bag and place all my gear in it as well.
review.name: Great design and spacious!

name: Viaje Cada Dia 35L Weekender Bag

I put in about 8-10k steps and 30-40 stair flights a day and these are by far the most comfortable, rugged, and stylish shoe I have ever had. They hold up very well to the stress I put on them. I feel so grateful I got these.
review.name: Amazing quality and comfort

review.reviewBody: I really enjoy the Terrawave Sneaker for everything I do. I walk our golden retriever twice daily and I do all my daily stuff with them. The Sneakers are comfortable and have just the right support for me without being over the top.
review.name: I will buy Terrawave Sneakers again. I love them.

review.reviewBody: I just bought a pair this evening and they were the most supportive and comfortable show I've ever purchased. I had tried on three others pairs of shoes before trying Terrawave sneaker and as soon as I put these ones on I knew they were the ones!
review.name: Absolute comfort

review.reviewBody: These sneakers were so comfortable the moment I put them on.
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody: This is a very comfortable shoe and excellent for walking.
review.name: I would buy this product again and again.

review.reviewBody: Wanted to get these to wear while I do photoshoots, and they're comfy! Was expecting a neutral beige color shoes but they're gray/purple.
review.name: Comfy, but "Blanc" is more Gray!

review.reviewBody: these shoes literally just arrived at my door, and they fit great! i got these basically free from a code teva donated to a lgbtq youth organization. the shoes are great and they support great causes.
review.name: amazing!

description: Buy the CAMP USA Blade Runner Alpine Crampon online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Blade Runner Alpine Crampon
hasVariant.description: Buy the CAMP USA Blade Runner Alpine Crampon online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
While on the heavy end of the spectrum, the layout of the front points in particular really provide a stable purchase on all types of ice, and they really feel solid on mixed rock placements. The weight tradeoff is worth it, unless one was trekking deep into the backcountry when grams add up.
I don't know what the previous reviewer is referring to as far as lack of front point availability - over the last three seasons I've purchase a number of replacement points (at the time of this review they are indeed in stock at Backcountry) for my and my wife's crampons. Maybe there was a production issue way back but apparently it has been resolved.
review.name: Bomber, Heavy, Confidence Inspiring

review.reviewBody: Probably my favorite mono point for water ice absolute love the secondary points and how secure I feel with not so great kicks
review.name: Great crampon for water ice

review.reviewBody:
First off, I'll say that these are decent crampons. I've put them through the wringer with about 70 pitches of ice the last two years and they performed better than other companies I've used. That being said, once you wear through the "replaceable" front points, you will not be able to find replacements.  

I've been looking for over a year to get replacement front points and even reached out to Camp directly but I've received radio silence. They are out of stock everywhere and have been for a long time. Front points are a consumable component of any crampon and pose a safety hazard if warn too short or corroded. These are the most expensive crampons out there and the fact that Camp does not support basic replacement parts is appalling. The crampons are still being sold and stocked so I don't buy that his is a supply chain issue. Save your money and support a company that supports it's products.
review.name: Good Crampons, Poor Product Support

name: Blade Runner Alpine Crampon

review.reviewBody: Seamless process of  researching and purchasing these outstanding boots on Backcountry.com. I contacted Backcountry.com customer service AND their technical team to get advice and guidance . . . which the provided in excellent fashion. Received the boots, matched them up with a new pair of Dynafit "Radical" touring bindings mounted on a new pair of WNDR "Intention 110" skis in 178cm length. PERFECT and flawless performance in both alpine (downhill) and alpine touring modes. Extremely comfortable boots (among the warmest I've ever worn!), terrific in either downhill or uphill (skinning/touring) mode. I'd highly recommend them to anyone looking for a great all-round, all-mountain/ski boot!
review.name: Absolutely LOVE these boots!

name: Cochise 120 Dyn Alpine Touring Boot - 2023

review.reviewBody: Lightweight and great for groups! Took it for a group of 11. Used the 2.5L and the 5 L pots and it worked perfectly. It uses very little gas also!
review.name: Sweet system

review.reviewBody: As a guide I've begun relying on this pot/Duo as my second stove set up with groups from 4 to 8. One stove is a dragonfly or whiisperlite and the second is the WindBurner Duo with the Stock Pot for reliable and quick water boiling.
review.name: Guided Groups

review.reviewBody: Bought this for a Boy Scout camp out to complement my MSR jet burner. Needed something that was light and could quickly bring water to a boil. It can easily handle 1 pound of pasta. Could probably handle one and a half to 2 pounds of pasta. The MSR jet burner brought the water to boil in no time. Highly recommend.
review.name: Great for boiling pasta on a hike. Lightweight and sturdy.

review.reviewBody: First I love the Giro helmet style it fits my oval head much better than the other brands I have worn.  It is a light helmet that fits snuggle to my head.  The chin straps are comfortable and easy to adjust.  It has ample air vents and though I have ridden in areas with temperatures above 90 degrees F felt comfortable.  One crashed and hit my head on the pavement with one of my previous Giro Mips helmets.  It provided excellent protection.
review.name: My favorate helmet

review.reviewBody: This helmet is excellent. I don't even really notice it has a bit more coverage than others. Fit and venting is perfect!
review.name: Great Fit!

review.reviewBody: I have never felt the need to wear a helmet while riding my bike, but with more people, especially young kids on the bike paths and streets with e-bikes it has become increasingly dangerous not to wear one.  I decided to purchase this brand and I love it and highly recommend this company. It's reasonably priced and you have the confidence that the helmets were designed especially for a weekend warrior or just a casual bike rider...and I love the color options as well! I am very color coordinated and stylish while riding my bike.
review.name: Best Decision

review.reviewBody: A comfortable helmet with good features at a surprisingly low price. Reasonably well ventilated and adjustable. I bought this helmet to use for riding gravel and mountain bikes during the cooler months of the year.
review.name: Comfortable helmet with good features

review.reviewBody:
I bought this helmet in December 2020 after getting bit by the serious cycling bug (a major Covid variant). It replaced a 10 year old Bell that I bought at WallyWorld. I was looking for high visibility, so I bought the radioactive yellow that Giro calls Highlight Yellow. I ride nearly every day and in a variety of cycling disciplines, road, gravel, triathlon/TT and MTB. I use this helmet for it all. In 2021, Strava said I made 325 rides and over 6k miles.

My head measures 23 inches in circumference and I bought the medium, so I think it is true to size. In the winter I put a thin Lifa stocking cap on underneath to stay warm. I live in NC, so it is hot here in the summer. Yes, I sweat, but I do not overheat in this helmet. It might not be the most aero design, but it is pretty good. I got 34 road segment KOMs in 2021 using my TT bike and this helmet. I thought about getting a TT helmet, but why?

I have been down a few times, MTB is rough, but have been lucky to not hit my head, so cannot comment on the protection. I will have to take Giros word on the safety of MIPS.
review.name: Great value in a MIPS helmet

review.reviewBody: Have 4 rides w/ this helmet & really have no complaints. Once it's on my head & adjusted I forget about it. Pretty solid ventilation. Fits good. Doesn't move around during my gravel rides. Zero problems w/ my 100% glasses. Seems like a safe helmet w/ a good price point of $90
review.name: Good value

review.reviewBody: A friend and his wife were asking about replacing their old head cage so I told them to  consider the Giro Agilis MIPS. Initial impressions were positive and I am glad they love the fit and aesthetics.
review.name: Recommended to a friend

review.reviewBody: A friend and his wife were asking about replacing their old head cage so I told them to  consider the Giro Agilis MIPS. Initial impressions were positive and I am glad they love the fit and aesthetics.
review.name: Recommend  to a friend

name: Agilis Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody:
Worn through 3 pairs as daily drivers for hikes and jobsite trailer duty.  
Technically the tongue strap placement is an improvement.  4d chassis is still a must, so I dont want other options with Salomon.  Im very hesitant on #4 because the latest rubber toe piece design ripped way too fast as compared to rips only after boot was past its duty cycle. Cant help but be reminded of the ripped rubber toe.  Buy again $$$ same result vs a different designed competitors boot. Love the comfort, dislike the length of life for the cost.  TBD
review.name: Looking at purchasing pair #4 but not sure

review.reviewBody: My new boots really got put to the test in the PNW. Rained for four straight days while hiking,  feet stayed nice and dry in the quest 4 gtx. Extremely happy
review.name: I recently got my new replacement gtx quest 4

review.reviewBody: I have now bought 3 pairs of these.  They are the best for hiking and provide the most durable support and flexibility a boot could have.
review.name: Best boots I have ever worn.

review.reviewBody: Used a brand new pair of quests starting beginning of August, about 25 days collectively of hunting, and about early november the shoes were fully worn out. Sole peeling off on multiple gashes, rubber/leather joints coming apart. I will say they were comfortable from the start, but did not make it all the way through one season. Will continue the search for a better shoe elsewhere..
review.name: short lasting comfort
comment: Hi, we are sorry to hear this happened to you. All our products come with a 2-year warranty against material and manufacturing defects. We're happy to reassure you that a case has been opened to address your worries, and we're looking forward to hearing from you. Check your inbox!

review.reviewBody: I got these boots a couple of months ago, they are a great fit, waterproof and very comfortable to wear.
review.name: Great Features

review.reviewBody:
I owned a pair of these in the past and had them for 5 or so years and they were absolutely solid boots. When they eventually wore out, I thought Id get another pair as they were faultless.
However, these boots are NOT the same build. The grip is terrible and they sprung leaks almost instantly.
The grip on wet rock is non existant and on numerous occassions Ive had extremeley dangerous slips in different settings. On wet rocks near the sea, even a wet pathway caused the boot to just slip with no control, its ridiculous. They are extremely dangerous and its only a matter of time before they cause someone to slip in a precarious spot.
Within 6 months a leak developed and after a year and a half of use both boots leak at the front.
The boot fits nicely and is cozy. If the boots were durable and had improved grip, theyd be great, but unfortunately this boot struggles at the most important parts.
review.name: No grip and no longevity
comment:
Hi Ashley! 
Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. 
We often make adjustments to our products based on direct customer feedback. We will be sure to pass on your feedback to the relevant department. 
We are sorry for any inconvenience caused.

review.reviewBody: Second pair of these boots. My first pair I got the desert tan ones and they fit like a glove. This time around I got the green pair and they were not as nice of a fit when first putting on. Quite rigid and needed to be broken in. I compared to my other pair and it seemed as if the material was slightly different. The first pair came from Cambodia the second from Vietnam. I ended up not liking the green color as much so I'll be returning to get the dessert tan again.
review.name: Good boot. Second pair.

review.reviewBody:
Wear conditions: woods, nursery farm, and other various terrain. Easily walk several miles a day due to work.

Daily wear for over a year, and the soles held up well! I normally struggle with one side of my shoe sole wearing down but these boots have held up, still are, in fact. I have ordered a pair as a gift for a friend, and just ordered my second pair. As long as they keep making them like this, I will be sticking with this boot for a long time to come. Highly recommend.
review.name: Great boots! Highly recommend.

review.reviewBody: 2nd pair of these, comfortable to wear, sturdy, long lasting.
review.name: Great boots

review.reviewBody: I have had my current one about 2 1/2 yrs as my daily wear love em just cant give them up yet still have a few miles left in them laces are about gone but I am searching for replacement
review.name: Great fit

review.reviewBody: Got these for my wife because I have the mens version. She said its like walking on a cloud! Grippy and good for long hikes which we do up here in the Rockies pretty frequently!

review.itemreviewed: Rogue Hiker Mid GTX Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: First real test of my new waterproof boots was a complete fail. Bought a new pair to replace my old Keens for a month long hiking vacation in the Canadian Rockies. Any amount of water on the trail causes water to seep in from low on the boot somewhere as the underside of the soles seem to be wetter than the tops. My socks are soaked and my flesh is bright white and water logged itself. My poor feet! If we were tent camping theyd never be dry by the next day. As is they have to sit over the heater vent upside down overnight to dry out. On the same trails, my husbands boots are completely dry. So disappointing! Love how these boots fit and wear but if you cant trust them for dry feet they are unwearable in the mountains.
review.name: Not waterproof!

review.itemreviewed: Rogue Hiker Mid GTX Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these boots for my daughter for hiking/hunting this season.  To start, they fit well and are super light.  Unfortunately, we only hiked a total of 3 miles on a manicured trail and the soles started falling apart.  Would have expected better durability from Merrell.
review.name: Great features but not durable

review.itemreviewed: Rogue Hiker Mid GTX Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: have excellent grip for rocky terrain. Wore them and had no issue when having to scramble up and down along with being comfy.
review.name: come and grippy
comment: Thank you for sharing your great feedback with us!

review.itemreviewed: Rogue Hiker Mid GTX Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These have great ankle support for most scenarios but it wouldnt be enough for serious distance full backpacking - for everything else though this boot is a winner. I really like the locking lacing hardware and how well it keeps me laced in exactly where I wanted. These first few outings with the boots have been 4-5 hour non-technical hikes, and no issues at all. I havent worn them in very wet areas and weather yet, but my other Merrell Gore-Tex have always lived up to expectations. There have been some very sandy and dusty trails and the bellows gussets kept that grit from making its way into my shoes and socks which is often a big frustration point for me with other shoes. The tread on these is very aggressive and kept up with scrambles over both loose sediment, mossy boulders, and damp leaf-litter covered flatrock. I got these in the bright orange because the sale price was unbeatable at the time and I didnt care what they looked like, but I have to say - I have had SO many people stop me on the trail to ask about them because they liked the unique colouring, so good job on that I guess! If these had the tiniest bit more torsional rigidity for ankle support, these would be my all-time perfect for everything boot, and I will definitely be looking at them again down the road after these wear out.
review.name: As close to perfect as you can get with a hybrid

review.itemreviewed: Polartec Power Grid Half-Zip Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Picked this up for the 3 passes Nepal Trek. It's a winner!. Let's air pass through for venting while strenuous hiking and keeping you warm when you stop to take a look around. Add a super light wind breaker and it is a the ultimate two piece trekking gettup!

review.itemreviewed: Polartec Power Grid Half-Zip Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Excellent warmth for the thickness and weight. Thumb loops help to provide a nice seal when wearing gloves to prevent heat loss. It feels a little different under the arm pits due to the stitching but its hard to notice with a base layer on underneath and you are moving and rucking around. Neck fabric is not irritating to the skin. Overall fabric withstands friction and abrasion well.
review.name: Fantastic midlayer

review.itemreviewed: Polartec Power Grid Half-Zip Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I love the color, which is purple even though is says blue. Nicely breathable and I like the thumb loops. I would like it to be a little softer on my skin as it feels a little rough
review.name: Great

review.itemreviewed: Polartec Power Grid Half-Zip Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have this in two colors. One of my most used pieces of gear. Great for stand alone warmth. Great as a base layer.
review.name: Im have 2 of these. Solid mid layer.

review.itemreviewed: Polartec Power Grid Half-Zip Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Polartec grid fleece has been my favorite fleece material for years. It is warm and breaths better than any other fleece on the market. MW nailed it! Great fit, good useable sized pocket, a true half zip, and a great cuff design!! Love this fleece
review.name: One of the best fleece ever!

review.itemreviewed: Polartec Power Grid Half-Zip Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: One of my favorite layers. Great quality fleece, warm but still very breathable. Im 511 and 185 with an athletic build. Had to go with a large to get the shoulders to fit comfortably but the body is a bit boxy. The medium was the preferred body size but was tight in the lats and forearms. But still giving it 5 stars because of the fleece.
review.name: One of the best layers.

review.itemreviewed: Polartec Power Grid Half-Zip Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Love the warmth and the fit-- cut closer to the body above the hips and slightly longer than others. Another great product from Mountain Hardwear.
review.name: Terrific mid layer

review.reviewBody:
This is by far the worst purchase I ever made from  Backcountry.  I wear a size 12.  Based on the reviews, I decided to purchase an XL to ensure I wouldn't have the problems 
mentioned by the other customers.  This coat is the worst fitting coat I have ever tried on.  I received this same brand  of coat from my husband at Christmas.  I hated it but decided to keep it as it was a gift.  Super big on top and so tight on the bottom that I have to use the double zipper to unzip the bottom around the hip area every time I wear it.  Over the years I have purchased 15-20 coats from Backcountry.  I think I'm done.  Last few were really cheap looking, and poor fitting.  I purchased 3 at Christmas time!  Done, done, and done.
review.name: Worst purchase I ever made

review.reviewBody: I bought a small and although it is snug, I don?t need any added sweater to keep me warm. Length is perfect and love how lightweight and warm it is. Glad I purchased
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: After opening the jacket from the packaging, there were little bits of down poking out from the seams all over the jacket. After trying it on, the bottom half didn't fit very well either.
review.name: Fluff coming out and doesn't fit well

review.reviewBody: This jacket is AMAZING!! The hand feel is so soft but also this jacket has the down quality to keep you nice and toasty. This jacket has a slightly slim fit so I did size up one size (due to preference bc I like a bigger fit) and the bottom hem has zippers you can open up to give you more room if you would like. I get SO MANY compliments on this every time I wear it.
review.name: Pictures don?t do this justice

review.reviewBody: I'm super bummed, I got a Basin and Range coat several years ago that I absolutely loved, but this one has feathers coming out everywhere after one long dog walk, and I agree that while the top fits perfectly, the hips are a joke they're so small. I'm sending it back!
review.name: Disappointing quality

review.reviewBody: My bone structure is (I guess) too big for this coat. The medium should have worked, I returned it and got the large, too small in the hips, too.  I'm lean, but that didn't matter. I was very bummed.
review.name: Doesn't work with wider hip bones

review.reviewBody: I?m more of a pear shape and this didn?t work at all. First tried the medium and it made me look like a sausage trying to escape its casing (on the bottom). I tried a large (I wear a small in t-shirts and 34B) and it was gigantic on top and the same dang size on the bottom. So bummed because it was so soft and I loved the color!
review.name: So cute but didn?t work.

name: Northstar Down Jacket - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Zodiac Plus GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I absolutely love these boots - they are perfect for summer-early fall PNW hiking/scrambling. They offer great traction on scree, rocks, mud, whatever terrain you find yourself on. They really hit that perfect niche for treks where a mountaineering boot is overkill (and uncomfortable) but trailrunners/traditional hikers would struggle. 

I'm an EU 42.5 in Scarpa and these fit true to size. Like many of their designs, it's a bit wider in the toebox. 

The only issue I have with these boots is the heel-lift. By the end of some hikes the backs of my ankles are raw. However, this can be avoided with a thicker sock or some moleskin.
review.name: Great boots*

review.itemreviewed: Zodiac Plus GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Ive been wearing one month  they are stiffer than my previous boots and have better traction which was what I needed. Comfort has not been an issue
review.name: Traction excellent

review.itemreviewed: Zodiac Plus GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is my 2nd pair of these boots. Best scrambling boots I've owned...certainly would work well for trail use as well, but all of my outing with these have been off trail in the rocky steeps. They are fast, light and have the best "lockdown" for my foot shape of any boot I've tried. Durability has exceed my expectations as well, on the upper and soles/tread! For me, they absolutely fit true to size.
review.name: Back for more

review.itemreviewed: Zodiac Plus GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I got these late 2020 for a trip around the White Cloud Peaks Trail in Sawtooth NF.  I think we did 40 miles in 5 days, 45 lb pack.  I was fine, no deteriorating soles like others have reported, and no foot issues.  I recently did 6 days and probably 45-50 miles in the Sierras with a 45 lb pack, plus a one day trip up Banner Peak (just a summit pack, 10 hours though) in these, again no issues.  I'm impressed how well suede holds up, and I was hopeful that the relatively few seams would mean these will last longer.  I've only done two trips but so far so good.

I got these in response to a pair of Asolo Drifters I have that tore at the seam near the ball of my foot. The Asolos fit well and were great out of the box but tore after 8 or 9 trips.  I can't compare durability of the two yet, too little mileage on the Scarpa.  The Asolo boots I've had fit great but I think the Scarpa are a touch wider at the ball of the foot, and therefore fit me a bit better.  I'm not thrilled with the insoles in either boot, and imho the only way to remedy that is if you can try the boots on and try a boot/insoles combination  in the store because insoles usually totally change the volume inside the boot.  Having ordered by mail and not having that luxury with these Scarpas I address the thin stock insoles by wearing thicker socks, ymmv. 

In US sizes I wear a 11 wide or 11.5 regular width.  I size up to 12 for backpacking boots.  The Scarpas feel true to size.  I have some LS Nepal Cubes and if La Sportiva boots are all similar then I can say if you're a La Sportiva fan fit-wise then the Scarpa and Asolo will likely be too wide at the ball of the foot.  Boots are so sensitive to each persons foot shape, you really have to try them on to tell if they're right for you, but from my personal experience there is nothing wrong with these Zodiac+ boots and a lot right, especially the durability to weight ratio.

Regarding the toe bang issues and other things I've read on some reviews, I've avoided those issues by sufficiently upsizing and changing the lacing patterns and tightness depending on if I'm ascending or descending.  There are a lot of good videos about how to use your laces to help adress changing needs throughout an excursion.  Backcountry has always been great letting me return boots if I couldn't get them to fit right and so long as i only tried them on inside and walked on carpet (so they can still sell them).
review.name: Good Boots So Far

review.itemreviewed: Zodiac Plus GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought this boot last minute and only had four days to break them in before heading out to do the Mountaineer's Route on Mt Whitney. The boot I had planned on using I decided had too much wear. Shame on me for waiting on finding a better boot sooner but these boots felt fantastic right out of the box. They DO run small but I tried them on in store (didn't order on Backcountry) and found that a 46 fit well for me. I typically wear a 45.5 (size 11.5 US).  These boots crushed it on Whitney. Zero hotspots, zero big toe pain, and no blisters.  I'm sold on this boot.
review.name: Superb Boot

review.itemreviewed: Zodiac Plus GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is my third pair of Scarpa boots.  I have a low-volume, flat foot with a wide forefoot.  Their last fits me great!  It either fits or doesn't fit.  I'm an 11.5 - 12 in nike running shoes, and am a solid and consistent 45 in Scarpa.  I replaces the inserts with some blue SuperFeet inserts.  With that change, they are perfect!  Boot fits me snugly with no heel motion.  Has a very grippy sole that felt pretty secure on wet rock.  I like the wrap around rubber bumpers on toe and heel, especially for rocky mountain terrain in New England.  Comfortable enough for me right out of the box, and am looking forward to getting them thoroughly broken in.  So far, just a few 4-6 mile hikes with around a 30# pack.  No soreness or hot spots.    A very nice heel to toe rocker.  Looking forward to putting more miles on these!  After hiking pretty rough, rocky trails, they look dusty, but not scuffed up.  Also, I have not had any issues with the sole breaking down that some others have reported.  I got these in June, '21 and think they must have gotten that sorted out.  I also have the Zen Pro approach shoes.  I wear a 45 in each, but feel the Zen Pro has a tighter toe box and a lower-volume fit.  Blue superfeet in the Zodiac, but I can t fit them into the Zen Pro.  I have to wear those with the original, thinner insert.
review.name: Great boot for my low-volume foot!

review.itemreviewed: Zodiac Plus GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I really, really wanted these boots to do well since they had such high ratings as a semi-mountaineering boot / Hiking boot.  I do a lot of scrambling and thought this boot would be perfect.
I've been hiking/climbing for 40 years and have worn many brands/styles of boots and this is the first pair that I found to be so totally painful to wear.
After wearing them, especially on descents I would get a stabbing pain on the balls of my feet - metatalsargia.  This is caused by the toe box being too small.
Inserted some insole with metatarsal pads but then my toes went numb due to the boot pressing down, blocking circulation.  In order to complete the hike I had to re-lace the boots so that they wouldn't bear down on the top of the toes/in-steps, but this created a very sloppy fit over the instep.
You shouldn't need to go through this much hassle.
Finally, the narrow box caused my middle toe to bang into the front during down hikes; Big toe was fine so it was not a length problem; the front of the boot has too radical of a curve where it transitions to the side.

I have a pair of Scarpa Ribelle's and they don't give me this problem.
Be way of this boot and try it out fully before committing.
review.name: Very Disappointed
comment:
Hey Christine
	Sorry the fit on the Scarpa Zodiac boots wasn?t right for you! Finding a perfect fit on boots can be super tricky, as someone with an incredibly narrow foot I always struggle.  
	We do offer gearhead support if you do ever need help finding a pair that will fit your feet better. It

review.itemreviewed: Zodiac Plus GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I really appreciate the reviewer who pointed out heel lift problem. You have to be very sharp to notice it. I used $65 Currex insoles to make it work. But with crampons on I still feel the lack of snugness. The design is so bad. There is no cup at the heel part, the whole back wall is just straight up. Some cheap boots like Solomon have the same design (no cups), but they at least bend the shaft forward by narrowing the back side. To reduce heel lift problem you have to tight the boots to your bones. If Scarpa corrects this problem, Zodiac are very versatile.  With this thing I can climb anything in front of me - Ice, snow, rocks. They are very good on rocks, Class 4 scrambling with confidence. I was about to buy Zodiac Tech, but because of this flaw I am holding out for now. Bottom rubber and wide toe box are first class. Feel like a soft version of La Sportiva Napal Cube GTX. Come on Scarpa designers! Come out and hike. Don't just sit in the lab and design stuff. Because of this problem, the boots feel like $150 worth.
review.name: The boots fall short

review.itemreviewed: Zodiac Plus GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I have a rotation of 6 or 7 different pairs of boots at use and these have Become my number one. Fit is obviously an individual thing and I would say I have an average to average wide foot and these fit me perfectly. No break in required in my case...I threw them in and out them through the most grueling test possible on my first outing...no issues or hot spots. I have not tried these boots on trail, as I have others for that. These boots are a standout, for me, in the level of support and security they provide. I spend a good deal of my time hiking a 40 to 60? river bank/slope... either climbing, side hilling, or descending and it can be murder on feet. My feet simply do not slide around at all when descending or side-hilling in these. Lots of "structure" in the fore and in mid foot which provides unparalleled security when side-hilling.. Ankle support is pretty good as well for a mid-boot. If you are looking for a hardcore scrambling boot and this one fits your foot, it should be a winner. There isn't much built-in arch support, which is a plus for my preference... Just put in the insole of your choice and your good to go.

 I don't expect these to last as long as some of my burlier boots, but I don't care. As long as they don't fall apart after 15 outings I will be back for more; if they do, I will report back.
review.name: The Best

review.itemreviewed: Zodiac Plus GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Best looking hiking boots, very firm. Wish I would've ordered up one size but I already worn them and past the 30 days. Just have to wear a bandaid on my heel. Other than that, I love them. They feel very protective.
review.name: Great boots
